RelativeTemporalAnnotation.TEXT: Admission Date : 08/07/1992 Discharge Date : 08/10/1992 HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : This is an 81 year old female with a right breast mass with a discharge . A mammogram of the right breast with shadow biopsy was negative . In the fall of 1991 , nipple changes and discomfort was again noted . A mmamogram showed no change on right , but new biopsy was positive . On the left , there was a new shawdown but the biopsy was negative . The patient presents now for right modified radical mastectomy with impant . HOSPITAL COURSE : The patient was taken to the Operting Room on 8/7/92 , where a right modified radical mastectomy was performed . Subsequently a saline-filled right breast implant was performed . The patient tolerated the procedure extremely well . Two drains were used . One drain was removed on postoperative day number two , and the second drain she will be discharged to home with .
